intro: Stephania mashanica, commonly known as the Chinese beggar's tick, is a climbing shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its palmately compound leaves and distinctive, spurred flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties have made it a subject of interest in horticulture and traditional medicine.
